content: <metadata>    <idinfo>       <smtype>1</smtype>       <citation>          <citeinfo>             <origin>Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN</origin>             <pubdate>1996</pubdate>             <title>Archive of Census Related Products (ACRP): 1990 Street Intersections</title>             <edition>1.00</edition>             <geoform>tabular</geoform>             <serinfo/>             <pubinfo>                <pubplace>Saginaw, MI</pubplace>                <publish>NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)</publish>             </pubinfo>             <onlink>http://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H42Z13FP</onlink>             <smcilnkh>true</smcilnkh>             <lworkcit>                <citeinfo>                   <serinfo/>                   <pubinfo/>                </citeinfo>             </lworkcit>          </citeinfo>       </citation>       <descript>          <abstract>The 1990 Street Intersections portion of the Archive of Census Related Products (ACRP) contains the latitude and longitude of street intersections for each county in the United States. The data includes the names of both streets that intersect, as well as the location and unique node number for streets which frequently intersect each other. This portion of the ACRP is produced by the Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN).</abstract>          <purpose>To provide street intersection data for each county in the U.S.</purpose>          <supplinf>These data can be used to provide: a nearest location (i.e. mortgage deed); point data that can be imported into a desktop GIS measure and copied to any geographic layer (e.g. census tract); and to calculate street density (number of street intersections per land area or unit).</supplinf>       </descript>       <timeperd>          <timeinfo>             <sngdate>                <caldate>19900401</caldate>             </sngdate>          </timeinfo>       </timeperd>       <status>          <progress>Complete</progress>          <update>As
